update.description:
Depends on [ign-rendering pull request #97](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/97)

The threaded rendering setup is based on [this Qt example](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtquick-scenegraph-textureinthread-example.html). As for rendering, instead of creating Qt FBO objects and using them for rendering and display, we’re creating a Qt texture from Ogre’s OpenGL render texture and displaying that in QQuickItem.

This approach works for both ogre 1.9 and ogre 2.1 render engine in ign-rendering

To test, start `ign gui` and insert the `Scene3D` plugin
update.title: Ogre + QtQuick integration take 2

content.raw: Ok, remembered 1 second after commenting. On default, we handle the `close` events to ask the user if they'd like to save, I think that's why we close instead of quit. But we're not doing this here yet, so I think this solution is ok for now.
content.html: Ok, remembered 1 second after commenting. On default, we handle the close events to ask the user if they'd like to save, I think that's why we close instead of quit. But we're not doing this here yet, so I think this solution is ok for now.

content.raw: I think there was a reason for not calling quit, but I can't remember it now and all the tests pass, so looks good to me!
content.html: I think there was a reason for not calling quit, but I can't remember it now and all the tests pass, so looks good to me!

content.raw:
This is mainly just for testing. I’m moving the camera slowly by this offset to show that the image displayed is not just a static image.

I thought it’s more interesting to show something happening compared to a black window. The camera movement here and the test scene will be removed after integration with the scene service.
content.html:
This is mainly just for testing. I’m moving the camera slowly by this offset to show that the image displayed is not just a static image.

I thought it’s more interesting to show something happening compared to a black window. The camera movement here and the test scene will be removed after integration with the scene service.

content.raw: It seems to end in deadlock. I changed it to `App()->quit()` instead and verified that `~Application` destructor is called. [39e420c](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/39e420ca8fc9502354f6d85e4d13c9a8abf401e7)
content.html: It seems to end in deadlock. I changed it to App()->quit() instead and verified that ~Application destructor is called. 39e420c

content.raw: yeah it provides an isolated place for rendering calls. Updated doxygen comments. [2d60898](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/2d60898ce895adf6845d7f64daa02e67df3ec6d7)
content.html: yeah it provides an isolated place for rendering calls. Updated doxygen comments. 2d60898

content.raw: yep done. [2d60898](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/2d60898ce895adf6845d7f64daa02e67df3ec6d7). I also ported the igndbg msg and `TODO` comment.
content.html: yep done. 2d60898. I also ported the igndbg msg and TODO comment.

content.raw: @iche033 , not sure if you've noticed this, but when there is a `Scene3D` plugin loaded, pressing `Ctrl+C` on the terminal usually closes the window but doesn't kill the program. I've tracked it down to when it is [calling](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/a98552cbefdb1be4efc1bec6d5dd8f255c14b281/src/Application.cc?at=gz11&fileviewer=file-view-default#Application.cc-99) `window->close()` on the main window.
content.html: @iche033 , not sure if you've noticed this, but when there is a Scene3D plugin loaded, pressing Ctrl+C on the terminal usually closes the window but doesn't kill the program. I've tracked it down to when it is calling window->close() on the main window.

content.raw:
This is working great! I have a few suggestions on pull request #155.

It's not clear to me yet how we'll integrate other plugins with this, but we can leave this for future PRs. I think we can always copy this plugin's code to ign-gazebo and the logic to populate the scene directly to it.
content.html:
This is working great! I have a few suggestions on pull request #155.

It's not clear to me yet how we'll integrate other plugins with this, but we can leave this for future PRs. I think we can always copy this plugin's code to ign-gazebo and the logic to populate the scene directly to it.

content.raw: On `default`, we also [destroy the scene](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/e85dd5e98064d951c3d7ab7d98bb8abefa7b8ba7/src/plugins/Scene3D.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Scene3D.cc-90) if that's the last sensor on the scene. What do you think of doing it here?
content.html: On default, we also destroy the scene if that's the last sensor on the scene. What do you think of doing it here?

content.raw: Could you add a bit more documentation here explaining why this class is needed and how it's used? I suspect that it is always safe to make `ign-rendering` calls from within this class, either on `Render`, `Initialize` or `Destroy`, is that true?
content.html: Could you add a bit more documentation here explaining why this class is needed and how it's used? I suspect that it is always safe to make ign-rendering calls from within this class, either on Render, Initialize or Destroy, is that true?

content.raw: FYI @nkoenig , we need a new ign-rendering pre-release with [this PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/97)
content.html: FYI @nkoenig , we need a new ign-rendering pre-release with this PR
